full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 65 of 261 1205
LC6VMAX2 Kate - direct
1 A. Also in my thirties.
2 Q. Approximately when did you stop spending time with Maxwell?
3 A. My late twenties -- sorry, spending time or communicating?
4 Q. Spending time.
5 A. Oh, around 24.
6 Q. I want to switch gears.
7 When you were a teenager and in your twenties, were you addicted to any substances?
8
9 A. Yes.
10 Q. What were you addicted to?
11 A. I was addicted to alcohol, cocaine, and sleeping pills.
12 Q. How often did you use cocaine, alcohol, and sleeping pills?
13 A. Sporadically, but mostly weekly.
14 Q. When was the last time you used those substances that you just mentioned?
15
16 A. May 1st, 2003.
17 Q. Why did you stop using those substances then?
18 A. When I first started using substances, they helped me to cope with the way that I was feeling. And then the substance use got out of control and started to destroy my relationships and my health and my peace of mind. And I felt that I was going to die if I continued.
22
23 Q. Has your prior drug and alcohol use affected the memories you have?
24
25 A. No.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018402

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear Q&A format. The content discusses the witness's history of substance use and their relationship with Maxwell. The document is well-formatted and legible.
